00035 template<typename T, bool isNumber> struct getMinMaxImpl { // fallback for unsupportet types
00036     std::pair<T, T> operator()( const ValuePtr<T> &/*ref*/ ) const {
00037         LOG( Debug, error ) << "min/max computation of " << util::Value<T>::staticName() << " is not supportet";
00038         return std::pair<T, T>();
00039     }
00040 };
00041 template<typename T> std::pair<T, T> calcMinMax( const T *data, size_t len )
00042 {
00043     std::pair<T, T> result( data[0], data[0] );
00044     LOG( Runtime, verbose_info ) << "using generic min/max computation for " << util::Value<T>::staticName();
00045 
00046     while ( --len ) {
00047         if ( result.second < data[len] )result.second = data[len];
00048 
00049         if ( result.first > data[len] )result.first = data[len];
00050     }
00051 
00052     return result;
00053 }
00054 
00056 
00057 #ifdef __SSE2__
00058 
00059 // specialize calcMinMax for (u)int(8,16,32)_t /
00061 
00062 template<> std::pair< uint8_t,  uint8_t> calcMinMax( const  uint8_t *data, size_t len );
00063 template<> std::pair<uint16_t, uint16_t> calcMinMax( const uint16_t *data, size_t len );
00064 template<> std::pair<uint32_t, uint32_t> calcMinMax( const uint32_t *data, size_t len );
00065 
00066 template<> std::pair< int8_t,  int8_t> calcMinMax( const  int8_t *data, size_t len );
00067 template<> std::pair<int16_t, int16_t> calcMinMax( const int16_t *data, size_t len );
00068 template<> std::pair<int32_t, int32_t> calcMinMax( const int32_t *data, size_t len );
00069 #endif //__SSE2__
00070 
00071 template<typename T> struct getMinMaxImpl<T, true> { // generic minmax for numbers (this _must_ not be run on empty ValuePtr)
00072     std::pair<T, T> operator()( const ValuePtr<T> &ref ) const {
00073         return calcMinMax( &ref[0], ref.getLength() );
00074     }
00075 };
00077 }

00087 template<typename TYPE> class ValuePtr: public _internal::ValuePtrBase
00088 {
00089     boost::shared_ptr<TYPE> m_val;
00090 protected:
00091     ValuePtr() {} // should only be used by child classed who initialize the pointer themself
00092     ValuePtrBase *clone() const {
00093         return new ValuePtr( *this );
00094     }
00095 public:
00096     static const unsigned short staticID = util::_internal::TypeID<TYPE>::value << 8;
00098     struct NonDeleter {
00099         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00100             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00101             LOG( Debug, info ) << "Not freeing pointer " << ( void * )p << " (" << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00102         };
00103     };
00105     struct BasicDeleter {
00106         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00107             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00108             LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Freeing pointer " << ( void * )p << " (" << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00109             free( p );
00110         };
00111     };
00113     struct ObjectArrayDeleter {
00114         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00115             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00116             LOG( Debug, info ) << "Deleting object array at " << ( void * )p << " (" << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00117             delete[] p;
00118         };
00119     };
00126     ValuePtr( size_t length ): _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ) {
00127         if( length )
00128             m_val.reset( ( TYPE * )calloc( length, sizeof( TYPE ) ), BasicDeleter() );
00129 
00130         LOG_IF( length == 0, Debug, warning )
00131                 << "Creating an empty ValuePtr of type " << util::MSubject( staticName() )
00132                 << " you should overwrite it with a usefull pointer before using it";
00133     }
00134 
00142     ValuePtr( const boost::shared_ptr<TYPE> &ptr, size_t length ): _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ), m_val( ptr ) {}
00143 
00153     ValuePtr( TYPE *const ptr, size_t length ): _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ), m_val( ptr, BasicDeleter() ) {}
00154 
00165     template<typename D> ValuePtr( TYPE *const ptr, size_t length, D d ): _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ), m_val( ptr, d ) {}
00166 
00167     virtual ~ValuePtr() {}
00168 
00169     boost::shared_ptr<const void> getRawAddress( size_t offset = 0 )const {
00170         if( offset ) {
00171             DelProxy proxy( *this );
00172             const uint8_t *const b_ptr = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>( m_val.get() ) + offset;
00173             return boost::shared_ptr<const void>( b_ptr, proxy );
00174         } else
00175             return boost::static_pointer_cast<const void>( m_val );
00176     }
00177     boost::shared_ptr<void> getRawAddress( size_t offset = 0 ) { // use the const version and cast away the const
00178         return boost::const_pointer_cast<void>( const_cast<const ValuePtr *>( this )->getRawAddress( offset ) );
00179     }
00180 
00182     virtual std::string toString( bool labeled = false )const {
00183         std::string ret;
00184 
00185         if ( m_len ) {
00186             const TYPE *ptr = m_val.get();
00187 
00188             for ( size_t i = 0; i < m_len - 1; i++ )
00189                 ret += util::Value<TYPE>( ptr[i] ).toString( false ) + "|";
00190 
00191             ret += util::Value<TYPE>( ptr[m_len - 1] ).toString( labeled );
00192         }
00193 
00194         return boost::lexical_cast<std::string>( m_len ) + "#" + ret;
00195     }
00196 
00197     std::string getTypeName()const {return staticName();}
00198     unsigned short getTypeID()const {return staticID;}
00199     bool isFloat() const {return boost::is_float< TYPE >::value;}
00200     bool isInteger() const {return boost::is_integral< TYPE >::value;}
00201 
00203     static std::string staticName() {
00204         return std::string( util::Value<TYPE>::staticName() ) + "*";
00205     }
00206 
00212     TYPE &operator[]( size_t idx ) {
00213         return ( m_val.get() )[idx];
00214     }
00215     const TYPE &operator[]( size_t idx )const {
00216         return ( m_val.get() )[idx];
00217     }
00224     operator boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>&() {return m_val;}
00225     operator const boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>&()const {return m_val;}
00226 
00227     size_t bytesPerElem()const {return sizeof( TYPE );}
00228 
00229     std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> getMinMax()const {
00230         if ( getLength() == 0 ) {
00231             LOG( Debug, error ) << "Skipping computation of min/max on an empty ValuePtr";
00232             return std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference>();
00233         } else {
00234 
00235             const std::pair<util::Value<TYPE>, util::Value<TYPE> > result = _internal::getMinMaxImpl<TYPE, boost::is_arithmetic<TYPE>::value>()( *this );
00236 
00237             return std::make_pair( util::ValueReference( result.first ), util::ValueReference( result.second ) );
00238         }
00239     }
00240 
00241     std::vector<Reference> splice( size_t size )const {
00242         if ( size >= getLength() ) {
00243             LOG( Debug, warning )
00244                     << "splicing data of the size " << getLength() << " up into blocks of the size " << size << " is kind of useless ...";
00245         }
00246 
00247         const size_t fullSplices = getLength() / size;
00248 
00249         const size_t lastSize = getLength() % size;//rest of the division - size of the last splice
00250 
00251         const size_t splices = fullSplices + ( lastSize ? 1 : 0 );
00252 
00253         std::vector<Reference> ret( splices );
00254 
00255         DelProxy proxy( *this );
00256 
00257         for ( size_t i = 0; i < fullSplices; i++ )
00258             ret[i].reset( new ValuePtr( m_val.get() + i * size, size, proxy ) );
00259 
00260         if ( lastSize )
00261             ret.back().reset( new ValuePtr( m_val.get() + fullSplices * size, lastSize, proxy ) );
00262 
00263         return ret;
00264     }
00265     //
00266     scaling_pair getScalingTo( unsigned short typeID, autoscaleOption scaleopt = autoscale )const {
00267         if( typeID == staticID && scaleopt == autoscale ) { // if id is the same and autoscale is requested
00268             static const util::Value<uint8_t> one( 1 );
00269             static const util::Value<uint8_t> zero( 0 );
00270             return std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference>( one, zero ); // the result is always 1/0
00271         } else { // get min/max and compute the scaling
00272             std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> minmax = getMinMax();
00273             assert( ! ( minmax.first.isEmpty() || minmax.second.isEmpty() ) );
00274             return ValuePtrBase::getScalingTo( typeID, minmax, scaleopt );
00275         }
00276     }
00277 };
00279 // specialisation for complex - there shall be no scaling - and we cannot compute minmax
00280 template<> scaling_pair ValuePtr<std::complex<float> >::getScalingTo( unsigned short /*typeID*/, autoscaleOption /*scaleopt*/ )const;
00281 template<> scaling_pair ValuePtr<std::complex<double> >::getScalingTo( unsigned short /*typeID*/, autoscaleOption /*scaleopt*/ )const;
00283 template<typename T> bool _internal::ValuePtrBase::is()const
00284 {
00285     util::checkType<T>();
00286     return getTypeID() == ValuePtr<T>::staticID;
00287 }
